title: 108_hr2472
content: The Act titled "District of Columbia Budget Autonomy Act of 2003" amends Section 446 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act to address the enactment of the local budget. The Council must adopt the annual budget for the District of Columbia government within 50 days of receiving the proposal from the Mayor. Any budget supplements must also be adopted after a public hearing. In control years, the Mayor must submit the budget to the President for transmission to Congress, following specific budget procedures. The District of Columbia government must obtain approval from the Council or Congress before obligating or expending any amount, as outlined in specific sections of the budget regulations. Reprogramming of amounts after the annual budget adoption is also restricted. The annual budget for fiscal year 1995 onwards requires approval from the Council for any reprogramming of amounts, with additional expenditures needing offsetting reductions. The term 'control year' is defined in reference to the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995. Congressional review period for budget acts is also addressed in the amendments. The new paragraph specifies that Acts subject to section 446 and not in a control year will take effect after a 30-day period unless a joint resolution disapproving the Act is enacted. If the 30-day period ends when neither House is in session, an additional 5 days are granted. The new paragraph specifies that joint resolutions disapproving Acts subject to section 446 must pass both Houses of Congress within a certain period to repeal the Act. Conforming amendments are made to various sections of the Act. Amendments are made to various sections of the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995 and the National Capital Revitalization and Self-Government Improvement Act of 1997, specifically regarding the application of section 446 for control years. Amendments are made to section 446 by replacing "the fourth sentence" with "section 446(c)". Additionally, the item in the table of contents related to section 446 is amended. SEC. 446. Enactment of local budget. SEC. 3. Action by Council of District of Columbia on line-item vetoes by Mayor of provisions of budget acts. Section 404(f) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to change the wording regarding transmission of items to the President. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to clarify terminology within the subsection. In section 404(f) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, terminology is clarified by referencing the definition of 'control year' from another act. SEC. 4 amends Section 447 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act to allow employees to be hired if the position is authorized by the Council. SEC. 5 includes other conforming amendments related to changes in the federal role in the budget process. (a) Federal Authority Over Budget-Making Process amended for control years. Restrictions on budget approval during control years. Definition of 'control year' clarified. The term 'control year' is defined in section 305(4) of the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995. SEC. 6. CONTINUATION OF GENERAL PROVISIONS IN APPROPRIATIONS ACTS. Any general provision in a general appropriation bill for Federal payments to the District of Columbia will remain in effect until the enactment of a new bill for the following fiscal year. SEC. 7. EFFECTIVE DATE. The amendments in this Act apply to the District of Columbia's budgets starting from October 1, 2004.
